name: Retinacular ligaments
text: Retinacular ligaments form the anterior capsule of the knee and contribute to patellar stability.

name: Medial patellofemoral ligament (MPFL)
text: Medial patellofemoral ligament resists lateral translation of the patella and is the primary soft-tissue stabilizer against patellar dislocation.

name: Posterior capsular fibers
text: Posterior capsular fibers form the posterior capsule of the knee and contribute to posterior stability.

name: Oblique popliteal ligament
text: Oblique popliteal ligament reinforces the posterior knee capsule and contributes to posterior knee stability.

name: Superficial medial collateral ligament
text: Superficial medial collateral ligament resists valgus stress and stabilizes the medial knee.

name: Deep medial collateral ligament
text: Deep medial collateral ligament resists valgus stress and contributes to medial meniscal stability.

name: Posterior oblique ligament
text: Posterior oblique ligament resists valgus stress and internal rotation at the knee.

name: Lateral collateral ligament
text: Lateral collateral ligament resists varus stress and stabilizes the lateral knee.

name: Popliteofibular ligament
text: Popliteofibular ligament resists external rotation and contributes to posterolateral knee stability.

name: Arcuate ligament
text: Arcuate ligament provides posterior and posterolateral support to the knee.

name: Anterior cruciate ligament
text: Anterior cruciate ligament resists anterior tibial translation and rotational instability.

name: Posterior cruciate ligament
text: Posterior cruciate ligament resists posterior tibial translation and stabilizes the knee in flexion.

name: Ligament of Humphrey
text: Ligament of Humphrey contributes to stabilization of the lateral meniscus.

name: Ligament of Wrisberg
text: Ligament of Wrisberg stabilizes the lateral meniscus of the knee.

name: Transverse meniscal ligament
text: Transverse meniscal ligament connects the anterior horns of the menisci and stabilizes the meniscal complex.
